title: The making of the Agnès b. cardigan
subhead: Since its creation in 1979, the Agnès b. snap cardigan has sold more than two million pieces. Functional and timeless, it has been produced in more than 150 colors and 40 versions, immortalized by world-renowned photographers and even exhibited in museums.

The West Bank village of Palestine's forgotten Americans
subhead: In the occupied West Bank, 85% of Turmus Ayya's population are American-Palestinian citizens. Every summer, these dual nationals return to visit their families and maintain ties with their homeland. They find that their American passports offer no immunity from persecution by the army and settlers in this territory, where illegal Israeli settlements are rapidly expanding.

title: France's global news agency AFP buckles under pressure from rising populism
subhead: Targeted by several authoritarian governments, Agence France-Presse – one of the three leading global news agencies – has found itself struggling financially in the face of a fragile media sector, changing news consumption habits and the rapid rollout of AI.

title: Why foreigners love France but struggle with the French
subhead: While France captivates with its culture and lifestyle, the French, frequently caricatured as arrogant and impolite, often have a poor reputation. This ambivalence raises questions about the roots of anti-French sentiment abroad.
